chapter.title: Management of UCC systems in the &ucsUMC;

section.title: Initial setting up of a UCC environment
section.para: A setup wizard is provided for the initial configuration of a UCC environment. This guides you through the basic setting up of a UCC environment with thin clients or desktop clients. Different standard policies are created and configured. The setup wizard is suitable for small to medium-sized environments. The policies can also be manually configured in the &ucsUMC; for more complex requirements in which different policies are to be used for different containers of the LDAP directory or multiple DHCP subnets are to be operated. The policies required for each option is listed in the respective chapters.

The setup wizard is started via the &ucsUMC; module UCC Setup. In the main menu, you can firstly select whether to set up thin clients and/or desktop systems. The UCC image(s) is/are then downloaded depending on the selection.

UCS offers you the possibility of centrally managing the IP addresses and DNS/DHCP settings of a network in a network object in the LDAP. This can considerably facilitates the management of IP addresses: When creating a UCC client the next free IP address of the network is selected automatically. Also, DNS and DHCP settings are configured automatically.

It is now possible to select an existing network object in the Network configuration dialogue or create a new one. During the installation of an UCS system, a network object with the name default is created as standard. It uses the network of the &ucsMaster;. If only a certain IP segment is to be used for the UCC systems, a new network object can be created with the Specify a new IP segment dialogue. For example, if the IP addresses 192.168.100.100 to 192.168.100.200 are used for UCC systems, 192.168.100.0 must be entered as the Network address, 24 as the Netmask and 192.168.100.100 / 192.168.100.200 entered as the First IP address / Last IP address.

The network configuration of UCC clients is managed through DHCP in nearly all cases (the only exception are UCC terminal servers).
In the default setting, fixed IP addresses are assigned and only to clients registered in the LDAP.

section.title: Managing UCC systems in the &ucsUMC;
section.para: UCC systems are registered and administrated with the system role Univention Corporate Client in the computer management module of the &ucsUMC;. The UCC setup wizard automatically creates two computer containers for thin clients (cn=computers, cn=ucc-thinclients) and desktop systems (cn=computers, cn=ucc-desktops). These should be selected in the Container input field depending on the type of the UCC client.

The following settings must be configured for every UCC client as a minimum:
The Hostname of the client (composed of lowercase and uppercase letters, numbers, hyphens and underscores).
The MAC address of the client in the notation XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX. It is required for DHCP.
